00037 /* Events bits */
00038 #define A4L_BUF_EOBUF_NR 0
00039 #define A4L_BUF_ERROR_NR 1
00040 #define A4L_BUF_EOA_NR 2
00041 /* Events flags */
00042 #define A4L_BUF_EOBUF (1 << A4L_BUF_EOBUF_NR)
00043 #define A4L_BUF_ERROR (1 << A4L_BUF_ERROR_NR)
00044 #define A4L_BUF_EOA (1 << A4L_BUF_EOA_NR)
00045 
00046 struct a4l_subdevice;

00048 /* Buffer descriptor structure */
00049 struct a4l_buffer {
00050 
00051         /* Buffer's first virtual page pointer */
00052         void *buf;
00053 
00054         /* Buffer's global size */
00055         unsigned long size;
00056         /* Tab containing buffer's pages pointers */
00057         unsigned long *pg_list;
00058 
00059         /* RT/NRT synchronization element */
00060         a4l_sync_t sync;
00061 
00062         /* Counters needed for transfer */
00063         unsigned long end_count;
00064         unsigned long prd_count;
00065         unsigned long cns_count;
00066         unsigned long tmp_count;
00067 
00068         /* Events occuring during transfer */
00069         unsigned long evt_flags;
00070 
00071         /* Command on progress */
00072         a4l_cmd_t *cur_cmd;
00073 
00074         /* Munge counter */
00075         unsigned long mng_count;
00076 };
00077 typedef struct a4l_buffer a4l_buf_t;

00081 /* Produce memcpy function */
00082 static inline int __produce(a4l_cxt_t * cxt,
00083                             a4l_buf_t * buf, void *pin, unsigned long count)
00084 {
00085         unsigned long start_ptr = (buf->prd_count % buf->size);
00086         unsigned long tmp_cnt = count;
00087         int ret = 0;
00088 
00089         while (ret == 0 && tmp_cnt != 0) {
00090                 /* Check the data copy can be performed contiguously */
00091                 unsigned long blk_size = (start_ptr + tmp_cnt > buf->size) ?
00092                         buf->size - start_ptr : tmp_cnt;
00093 
00094                 /* Perform the copy */
00095                 if (cxt == NULL)
00096                         memcpy(buf->buf + start_ptr, pin, blk_size);
00097                 else
00098                         ret = rtdm_safe_copy_from_user(cxt->user_info,
00099                                                        buf->buf + start_ptr,
00100                                                        pin, blk_size);
00101 
00102                 /* Update pointers/counts */
00103                 pin += blk_size;
00104                 tmp_cnt -= blk_size;
00105                 start_ptr = 0;
00106         }
00107 
00108         return ret;
00109 }
00110 
00111 /* Consume memcpy function */
00112 static inline int __consume(a4l_cxt_t * cxt,
00113                             a4l_buf_t * buf, void *pout, unsigned long count)
00114 {
00115         unsigned long start_ptr = (buf->cns_count % buf->size);
00116         unsigned long tmp_cnt = count;
00117         int ret = 0;
00118 
00119         while (ret == 0 && tmp_cnt != 0) {
00120                 /* Check the data copy can be performed contiguously */
00121                 unsigned long blk_size = (start_ptr + tmp_cnt > buf->size) ?
00122                         buf->size - start_ptr : tmp_cnt;
00123 
00124                 /* Perform the copy */
00125                 if (cxt == NULL)
00126                         memcpy(pout, buf->buf + start_ptr, blk_size);
00127                 else
00128                         ret = rtdm_safe_copy_to_user(cxt->user_info,
00129                                                      pout,
00130                                                      buf->buf + start_ptr,
00131                                                      blk_size);
00132 
00133                 /* Update pointers/counts */
00134                 pout += blk_size;
00135                 tmp_cnt -= blk_size;
00136                 start_ptr = 0;
00137         }
00138 
00139         return ret;
00140 }

00142 /* Munge procedure */
00143 static inline void __munge(struct a4l_subdevice * subd,
00144                            void (*munge) (struct a4l_subdevice *, 
00145                                           void *, unsigned long),
00146                            a4l_buf_t * buf, unsigned long count)
00147 {
00148         unsigned long start_ptr = (buf->mng_count % buf->size);
00149         unsigned long tmp_cnt = count;
00150 
00151         while (tmp_cnt != 0) {
00152                 /* Check the data copy can be performed contiguously */
00153                 unsigned long blk_size = (start_ptr + tmp_cnt > buf->size) ?
00154                         buf->size - start_ptr : tmp_cnt;
00155 
00156                 /* Perform the munge operation */
00157                 munge(subd, buf->buf + start_ptr, blk_size);
00158 
00159                 /* Update the start pointer and the count */
00160                 tmp_cnt -= blk_size;
00161                 start_ptr = 0;
00162         }
00163 }
00164 
00165 /* Event consumption function */
00166 static inline int __handle_event(a4l_buf_t * buf)
00167 {
00168         int ret = 0;
00169 
00170         /* The event "End of acquisition" must not be cleaned
00171            before the complete flush of the buffer */
00172         if (test_bit(A4L_BUF_EOA_NR, &buf->evt_flags)) {
00173                 ret = -ENOENT;
00174         }
00175 
00176         if (test_bit(A4L_BUF_ERROR_NR, &buf->evt_flags)) {
00177                 ret = -EPIPE;
00178         }
00179 
00180         return ret;
00181 }
00182 
00183 /* Counters management functions */
00184 
00185 static inline int __pre_abs_put(a4l_buf_t * buf, unsigned long count)
00186 {
00187         if (count - buf->tmp_count > buf->size) {
00188                 set_bit(A4L_BUF_ERROR_NR, &buf->evt_flags);
00189                 return -EPIPE;
00190         }
00191 
00192         buf->tmp_count = buf->cns_count;
00193 
00194         return 0;
00195 }
00196 
00197 static inline int __pre_put(a4l_buf_t * buf, unsigned long count)
00198 {
00199         return __pre_abs_put(buf, buf->tmp_count + count);
00200 }
00201 
00202 static inline int __pre_abs_get(a4l_buf_t * buf, unsigned long count)
00203 {
00204         /* The first time, we expect the buffer to be properly filled
00205         before the trigger occurence; by the way, we need tmp_count to
00206         have been initialized and tmp_count is updated right here */
00207         if (buf->tmp_count == 0 || buf->cns_count == 0) 
00208                 goto out;
00209 
00210         /* At the end of the acquisition, the user application has
00211         written the defined amount of data into the buffer; so the
00212         last time, the DMA channel can easily overtake the tmp
00213         frontier because no more data were sent from user space;
00214         therefore no useless alarm should be sent */
00215         if (buf->end_count != 0 && (long)(count - buf->end_count) > 0)
00216                 goto out;
00217 
00218         /* Once the exception are passed, we check that the DMA
00219         transfer has not overtaken the last record of the production
00220         count (tmp_count was updated with prd_count the last time
00221         __pre_abs_get was called). We must understand that we cannot
00222         compare the current DMA count with the current production
00223         count because even if, right now, the production count is
00224         higher than the DMA count, it does not mean that the DMA count
00225         was not greater a few cycles before; in such case, the DMA
00226         channel would have retrieved the wrong data */
00227         if ((long)(count - buf->tmp_count) > 0) {
00228                 set_bit(A4L_BUF_ERROR_NR, &buf->evt_flags);
00229                 return -EPIPE;
00230         }
00231 
00232 out:
00233         buf->tmp_count = buf->prd_count;
00234 
00235         return 0;
00236 }
00237 
00238 static inline int __pre_get(a4l_buf_t * buf, unsigned long count)
00239 {
00240         return __pre_abs_get(buf, buf->tmp_count + count);
00241 }
00242 
00243 static inline int __abs_put(a4l_buf_t * buf, unsigned long count)
00244 {
00245         unsigned long old = buf->prd_count;
00246 
00247         if ((long)(buf->prd_count - count) >= 0)
00248                 return -EINVAL;
00249 
00250         buf->prd_count = count;
00251 
00252         if ((old / buf->size) != (count / buf->size))
00253                 set_bit(A4L_BUF_EOBUF_NR, &buf->evt_flags);
00254 
00255         if (buf->end_count != 0 && (long)(count - buf->end_count) >= 0)
00256                 set_bit(A4L_BUF_EOA_NR, &buf->evt_flags);
00257 
00258         return 0;
00259 }
00260 
00261 static inline int __put(a4l_buf_t * buf, unsigned long count)
00262 {
00263         return __abs_put(buf, buf->prd_count + count);
00264 }
00265 
00266 static inline int __abs_get(a4l_buf_t * buf, unsigned long count)
00267 {
00268         unsigned long old = buf->cns_count;
00269 
00270         if ((long)(buf->cns_count - count) >= 0)
00271                 return -EINVAL;
00272 
00273         buf->cns_count = count;
00274 
00275         if ((old / buf->size) != count / buf->size)
00276                 set_bit(A4L_BUF_EOBUF_NR, &buf->evt_flags);
00277 
00278         if (buf->end_count != 0 && (long)(count - buf->end_count) >= 0)
00279                 set_bit(A4L_BUF_EOA_NR, &buf->evt_flags);
00280 
00281         return 0;
00282 }
00283 
00284 static inline int __get(a4l_buf_t * buf, unsigned long count)
00285 {
00286         return __abs_get(buf, buf->cns_count + count);
00287 }
00288 
00289 static inline unsigned long __count_to_put(a4l_buf_t * buf)
00290 {
00291         unsigned long ret;
00292 
00293         if ((long) (buf->size + buf->cns_count - buf->prd_count) > 0)
00294                 ret = buf->size + buf->cns_count - buf->prd_count;
00295         else
00296                 ret = 0;
00297 
00298         return ret;
00299 }
00300 
00301 static inline unsigned long __count_to_get(a4l_buf_t * buf)
00302 {
00303         unsigned long ret;
00304 
00305         /* If the acquisition is unlimited (end_count == 0), we must
00306            not take into account end_count */
00307         if (buf->end_count == 0 || (long)(buf->end_count - buf->prd_count) > 0)
00308                 ret = buf->prd_count;
00309         else
00310                 ret = buf->end_count;
00311 
00312         if ((long)(ret - buf->cns_count) > 0)
00313                 ret -= buf->cns_count;
00314         else
00315                 ret = 0;
00316 
00317         return ret;
00318 }
